title: Saturated family
summary: In mathematics, specifically in functional analysis, a family G {\displaystyle {\mathcal {G}}} of subsets a topological vector space (TVS) X {\displaystyle X} is said to be saturated if G {\displaystyle {\mathcal {G}}} contains a non-empty subset of X {\displaystyle X} and if for every G âˆˆ G , {\displaystyle G\in {\mathcal {G}},} the following conditions all hold:
